verses.text: 「我實實在在告訴你們，那不從門進羊圈，倒從別處爬進去的，那人就是賊，就是強盜；

words.note: Often used in the Bible as a solemn declaration, equivalent to 'Amen, amen' or 'Verily, verily'.
Indicates a contrast or unexpected turn of events.
Transforms the preceding phrase into a noun-like entity (e.g., 'the one who...').

verses.text: 那從門進去的，才是羊的牧人。

words.note: Emphasizes that something happens or is true only under certain conditions.

verses.text: 看門的給他開門，羊也聽他的聲音；他按著名字呼叫自己的羊，領牠們出來。

words.note: Lit. 'the one who watches the door'.
Here, it acts as a preposition indicating the beneficiary of the action, 'for him'.
Can mean both 'to hear' and 'to obey', contextually 'obey' is implied.
Indicates following a method or rule.

verses.text: 他把自己的羊全都領出來以後，就走在前頭，羊也跟隨他，因為認得他的聲音。

words.note: Used to bring the object of a verb before the verb.
Indicates a consequence or immediate action.

verses.text: 牠們決不會跟隨陌生人，反而逃避他，因為不認得陌生人的聲音。」

words.note: Emphasizes certainty of not doing something.

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說了這個譬喻，他們卻不明白他所說的是甚麼。
於是耶穌又說：「我實實在在告訴你們，我就是羊的門。

words.note: A common emphatic phrase in biblical speech.

verses.text: 所有在我以先來的，都是賊和強盜；羊卻不聽從他們。

words.note: More formal/biblical than 以前 (yǐqián).

verses.text: 我就是門，如果有人藉著我進來，就必定得救，並且可以出、可以入，也可以找到草場。
賊來了，不過是要偷竊、殺害、毀壞；我來了，是要使羊得生命，並且得的更豐盛。

words.note: Indicates the manner or degree of the action.
Often used in the Bible for spiritual abundance.

verses.text: 我是好牧人，好牧人為羊捨命。

words.note: Often refers to sacrifice of life for a cause.

verses.text: 那作雇工不是牧人的，羊也不是自己的，他一見狼來，就把羊撇下逃跑，狼就抓住羊群，把他們驅散了；

words.note: Forms '一...就...' structure for 'as soon as...then...'
Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 因為他是個雇工，對羊群漠不關心。

words.note: Short for 一個 (yīgè).

verses.text: 我是好牧人，我認識我的羊，我的羊也認識我，
好像父認識我，我也認識父一樣；並且我為羊捨命。

words.note: Referring to God the Father in Christian theology.
Referring to God the Father in Christian theology.
Often refers to sacrifice of life for a cause.

verses.text: 我還有別的羊，不在這羊圈裡；我必須把牠們領來，牠們也要聽我的聲音，並且要合成一群，歸於一個牧人。

words.note: Often follows a location noun to indicate 'inside'
Implies allegiance or ownership.

verses.text: 父愛我，因為我把生命捨去，好再把它取回來。

words.note: Refers to God the Father in Christian context.

verses.text: 沒有人能奪去我的生命，是我自己捨去的。我有權把生命捨去，也有權把它取回來；這是我從我的父所領受的命令。」

words.note: Indicates the following verb is the object of the previous noun.

verses.text: 猶太人因著這些話又起了紛爭。

words.note: Refers to a heated debate or conflict.

verses.text: 他們當中有許多人說：「他是鬼附的，他發瘋了；為甚麼要聽他呢？」
另外有人說：「這話不是鬼附的人所說的。鬼怎能使瞎子的眼睛開了呢？」

words.note: A formal structure for 'what was V-ed'.

verses.text: 在耶路撒冷，獻殿節到了，那時是冬天。

words.note: Refers to Hanukkah.

verses.heading: Jesus at the Feast of Dedication

verses.text: 耶穌在殿的所羅門廊上走過，

words.note: A specific part of the Temple in Jerusalem.

verses.text: 猶太人圍著他，對他說：「你使我們心裡懸疑不定，要到幾時呢？如果你是基督，就公開地告訴我們吧！」

words.note: Lit. 'hanging in doubt, not settled'.

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「我已經告訴你們，你們卻不相信；我奉我父的名所作的事，可以為我作證。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for acting 'by command' or 'in the name of'.
Refers to God the Father in Christian context.
A formal structure for 'what was V-ed'.

verses.text: 只是你們不信，因為你們不是我的羊。
我的羊聽我的聲音，我也認識他們，他們也跟隨我。
我賜給他們永生，他們永不滅亡，誰也不能把他們從我手裡奪去。

words.note: 赐 is a more formal or religious way of saying 'give' or 'bestow'.
Used in the structure '誰也 + (不/沒有) + verb' to mean 'no one can...'

verses.text: 那位把羊群賜給我的父比一切都大，也沒有人能把他們從我父的手裡奪去。

words.note: 赐 is a more formal or religious way of saying 'give' or 'bestow'.
Refers to God the Father in Christian context.
Refers to God the Father in Christian context.

verses.text: 我與父原為一。」

words.note: More formal than 和 (hé) for 'and'.
Refers to God the Father in Christian context.
A formal construction often used in religious or philosophical contexts.

verses.text: 猶太人又拿起石頭要打他。

words.note: Lit. 'Judean people'

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「我把許多從父那裡來的善事顯給你們看，你們因哪一件要用石頭打我呢？」

words.note: Introduces object before verb, forming 'ba-structure'.
Connects an attribute to a noun, similar to 'which is'.
Softens the tone of a question or implies a rhetorical question.

verses.text: 猶太人對他說：「我們不是因為善事用石頭打你，而是因為你說了僭妄的話；又因為你是個人，竟然把自己當作 神。」

words.note: Lit. 'Judean people'
Indicates completion or actualization of an action.
Refers to arrogating what is not due, especially divine authority.
Introduces object before verb, forming 'ba-structure'.
Refers to the one true God, often capitalized in Bible.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「你們的律法上不是寫著『我說你們是神』嗎？

words.note: Used as a localizer, meaning 'in' or 'on'.
Here refers to humans addressed as 'gods' or 'judges' in Psalm 82:6.

verses.text: 聖經是不能廢除的，如果那些承受 神的道的人， 神尚且稱他們是神，

words.note: Forms an adjective or nominalized clause.
Refers to the one true God, often capitalized in Bible.
Often 'the Word' referring to divine revelation or Christ (Logos).
Nominalizes the preceding phrase, meaning 'those who'.
Refers to the one true God, often capitalized in Bible.
Used to introduce a stronger or more surprising case.
Here refers to humans addressed as 'gods' or 'judges' in Psalm 82:6.

verses.text: 那麼父所分別為聖又差到世上來的，他自稱是 神的兒子，你們就說他說了僭妄 神的話嗎？

words.note: Refers to God the Father.
Precedes verbs to form a nominal phrase.
Refers to the Christian God.
In this context, 'Son of God'.
Refers to the Christian God.

verses.text: 我若不作我父的事，你們就不必信我；

words.note: Refers to God the Father.

verses.text: 我若作了，你們縱然不信我，也應當信這些事，好使你們確實知道，我父是在我裡面，我也在父裡面。」

words.note: Refers to God the Father.
Refers to God the Father.

verses.text: 他們又要逮捕耶穌，他卻從他們的手中逃脫了。
耶穌又往約旦河東去，到約翰從前施洗的地方，住在那裡。
許多人到他那裡去，說：「約翰沒有行過一件神蹟，但約翰指著這人所說的一切話，都是真實的。」

words.note: Lit. 'divine trace' or 'divine sign'

words.definition: what was said, that which was spoken

verses.text: 在那裡就有許多人信了耶穌。
